results.title: Banksia Integrifolia
results.brief_description: Banksia intergrifolia: a species of native tree growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. Explores the patterns of the characteristic serrated leaves, then buds slowly maturing over many months into nectar-laden flowers. These slowly change to woody “Banksia men” cones. The sound track features a duet of two noisy Friars imitating a pair of Wattle Birds. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.

results.title: Bank of England
results.creator_credit: John Spencer, John Wiles, Bank of England and Films of Today
results.brief_description: An account of the history and day-to-day functions of the Bank of England and its role in financing Government and industry. Ludovic Kennedy, the presenter, explains the Bank’s role as Government broker and banker, its tasks in issuing Treasury bills, exercising exchange control, keeping the gold reserves, acting as banker to the major clearing banks and printing the country’s supply of banknotes.

results.title: The Bank holiday crisis of 1933
results.creator_credit: William Russell, James Fonda and Young America Films
results.brief_description: In March, 1933, President Roosevelt declared a bank holiday to help the American nation recover from the panic of financial collapse. The situation is shown in scenes in a bank, in soup kitchens and milk lines and in a Salvation Army home in New York. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Banana story
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock, Cambridge Film Productions and Australia Health Publicity Control Council
results.brief_description: An account of the banana growing industry in northern New South Wales, showing all stages in the growing of bananas; areas of Queensland and New South Wales most suited to banana growing; tree felling and clearing the land; preparation of the ground; planting; pest and disease control; development of the fruit on the plant; picking, grading, packing and transporting the fruit to all states; finally ripening the fruit prior to sale at local markets.

results.title: Bamiri: the story of a village that helped itself
results.brief_description: The story of a village that helped itself. When the villagers of Bamiri in Ashanti decided to build themselves a Community Centre they scarcely realised how this would stimulate the progress of the village. Now the people of Bamiri are not only improving their village materially, but they are educating themselves in many other ways. No other credits available.

results.title: Balzac
results.creator_credit: Jean Vidal, AE Films and Les Films du Compas
results.brief_description: Contemporary paintings, manuscripts and lithographs are used in this film depicting the life of Balzac, nineteenth century French novelist. Beginning with shots of the workroom in which Balzac wrote many of his novels, the film flashes back to the Napoleonic era during which the writer was born. The film traces his boyhood, his career, the mounting of his debts, his love affairs, and concludes with his death which came after he had recreated a whole society in his ninety-six novels.

results.title: The Baltimore plan
results.brief_description: Explains how a young social worker aroused the interest of citizens, government officials, and a local newspaper in the housing conditions in Baltimore’s slums. Describes the “Baltimore Plan” which made minimum housing standards a legal requirement and which created a Housing Court to enforce the laws. Shows how officials and citizens in Baltimore attacked the problem in selected areas. No other credits available.

results.title: The Baltic story
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bradley and Gordon Bradley Ltd
results.brief_description: Produced for the Baltimore Mercantile and Shipping Exchange, this film describes the world-wide activities of the Baltic Exchange. This is the international centre for the chartering of ships and aircraft - a vast clearing house where carriers are found for cargo and cargo for carriers - to and from any port in the world. The Baltic has the distinction of being the world’s only shipping exchange. Narrated by John Le Mesurier the film features the work of a broker, John Hall, during a day at the exchange.

results.title: Balmain
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Expresses the popular protest of residents in the inner Sydney suburb of Balmain against the industrial development of the foreshore as a major container shipping port. Discusses the historic buildings and traditional character of the area and the radical changes expected. Shows the problems of the city planning involved.

results.title: Ball on vole
results.brief_description: The apparently aimless flight of a ball which goes out of reach and wanders where it will, is presented in a series of amusing incidents and co-incidences as five boys try to capture it. Drama follows its appearance wherever it goes, people are bumped and shot, and it eludes them to the end. A whimsical film with a unique sense of humour.
